intro: Pilosella euchaetia subsp. tscherningii, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky and gravelly soils, often found in mountainous environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
